storyInfo: The year is 1030. Theresa and Theresis visit the Scar Market to prepare for the founding of the 'Military Commission'. Theresa mentions her dream of building Babel again.

attributes.content: Scar Market, Kazdel
You protect this tag around your neck with your LIFE! You're MY precious property, slave!
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: You understand?! *Sarkaz swearing* You'd better be worth something.
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: Stay here and don't move. You, you inspect the goods?
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: The slave trader casts a glance at the silent slave behind the mercenary's back, then slightly shakes his head.
Where'd you get it?
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: Found him on my way here, dying of thirst and about to become mangler chow. Thought he could fetch a good price.
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: I... came from Kazdel... I can find someone who...
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: Doesn't matter to us where you're from, slave. Say you're Higashinese for all we care, as long as someone buys you out.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: I'm just checking if you've got a tail. You never know where these mercs get their 'goods'.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: I promise you he's clean.
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: You better not be messing with me. Cash or barter?
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: Ain't gonna live long enough for money to mean something. Give me some good weapons.
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: You're the boss. He's second-rate, at best... that'll net you two blades, freshly cast.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: How about you take another look, with your eyes open this time!
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: You can dress him up as a first-rate, but it won't change anything. If you don't like our offer, feel free to get lost.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: And put that machete of yours away...
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: This is the Scar Market you're in.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: ...Can you throw in more? I was out on the Leithanien border before I got back, I've got first-hand intel about the whole war in the Core—
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: Well, here's something for nothing: careful what you spew out of that mouth if you want to stay alive here.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: Mouthing around you have valuable 'first-hand intel'... You want to guess where that'll get you?
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: Leave the goods and scram. You're holding up the line.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: *grunt*.
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: Not happy? Drown your sorrows in the bar. Our boss, Scareye, brews one heck of a drink. Doesn't matter if you can't pay your tab... they'll take your weapons as collateral, merc.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: One more thing... where do you run your bounty board? I'm here to strike it rich.
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: The barfolk'll be happy to inform you.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: *Sarkaz swearing*.
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: The merc stares around this floating hub, hidden away in the giant subterranean hollow beneath Kazdel.
Amidst the moans of the slaves, the faint yet constant rumble of lava and bursts of Originium dust can be heard rising from beneath the market.
Eyeing the rugged path behind him, the mercenary recalls the perils he faced to reach here from the surface and shudders.
Just how many people are there in that goddamn... chasm?
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: Enough to break your fall, if you jumped. Welcome to the Scar Market, greenhorn. You'll love it here.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: What's the deal over there? Why the crowd?
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: Probably another big name just rolled back into town.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: Aren't you here to 'strike it rich'? Go on, then. I'd rather keep my horns out of all that mess.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: The merc vaguely makes out a pale white figure flitting through the chaotic gloom of the street.
White clothes? You don't see that everyday in Kazdel.
You're injured.
Tell me something I don't know.
attributes.name: Wounded Mercenary

attributes.content: Gkh! *cough* *cough*! You're—
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: The last time I was here, it was someone else handling transactions.
Guh. Yes...
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: You're referring to my grandfather. He never stopped bragging about how he'd fought you and lived.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: I'm surprised you'd remember him. In the good sense, though, that means he wasn't lying all this time. It must've been sixty years ago by now...
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: ...General Theresis.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: Already? How sad that nothing here has changed at all.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I imagine with Her Highness here, too, there'll be no more violence this time, eh?
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: Even if things get bloody, eventually you'll leave, but we'll always be here, General. We'll always have business, so long as Kazdel's unrest never rests.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: Even now, I remember one thing my grandpa mentioned in his boasts. He said to you, it's the land of Kazdel that needs us.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: Theresis looks at the slaves, their heads down in their cages. He draws his sword.
War and turmoil have necessitated this trade for over a century... this Scar Market.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: G... General—I...
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: Provided you can reach the surface alive... Take a fresh look at Kazdel.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Much of what you know will soon change. All Sarkaz will be part of this change.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: All? Us too?
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: Yes. I'm not inclined to explain our vision to the likes of you. But I will stay here a while longer and wait for her return.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Until then, I welcome you mercenaries to challenge me, just as sixty years ago.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I will take you to Kazdel, willingly or otherwise.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: His voice isn't loud, but every Sarkaz present hangs onto his every word.
The mixed-blood Sarkaz stands alone—no retinue, no army—armed only with an ordinary-looking longsword, casually held in the hand that wields it.
His steely gaze pierces through the dim of the street, settling calmly in the direction of the only person he cares for.
You can dismiss the mercenaries in ambush. No doubt they're your most trusted men.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: This is out of my respect for the King of Sarkaz. None aside from the General can claim to know your true motives, after all.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Your Highness, do you truly believe this can change the fate of the Sarkaz? That you're not just another ill-fated hero caught in this cycle of hope and failure?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Once the dust has all settled, your answer will come naturally.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Following that pyrrhic victory, we built from zero a moving city, the great nomad of Sarkaz soil for over a century now.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We can evade Catastrophes and foreign armies. Our development has finally reached a point of basic self-sufficiency. But it's so far from enough.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The storm has long been brewing on the horizon, but we were too oblivious, like a burdenbeast too slow to react, too old to move.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your Highness must be referring to that war between Leithanien and Gaul.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Surely you, too, are aware of the magnitude of that war.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Corsica I even secretly hired our Royal Court Casters as his consultants, but despite a period of seclusion, Leithanien's Witch King thwarted Gaul's offenses with his opening move.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: And now, Ursus and Victoria have also declared war on Gaul.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: These present empires display a might so far removed from the enemy one hundred and thirty years ago, against which we staked all Kazdel just to barely prevail.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: That was already a victory in name only. If Kazdel must now be thrust into the same situation, how could it possibly end?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It is for this end that you wish to establish the 'Military Commission of Kazdel'.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Yet, the old aristocrats of the Royal Court grow resentful, refusing to relinquish their sumptuous city lives and viewing this as an attempt to challenge their privileges.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: A century of peace is enough for certain memories to slip their minds.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: So, what made you deign to come here in person? Do you see the 'Scar Market' as the 'Royal Court' for the bottom-feeders, where the likes of us scape by and make merry?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: My only hope is for more Sarkaz to join us and resist the voices that refuse to embrace change.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Resist? Perhaps your Highness meant 'terrorize' and 'purge'.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: What I want is a reform, not a slaughter.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: So, what's the reward?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: The Scar Market's not a real Royal Court. What we have with the mercenaries is partnership, not fealty. Without compensation, no one will work for us.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: ...Reward?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Are the spoils of war not enough? Are the riches, power, or food that should have gone to the hungry people not enough to sate your appetite?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You claim to provide shelter and a livelihood for countless Sarkaz warriors with your rhetoric of justice... Yet, I could almost hear their bones crunch as you squeeze them dry for profit.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Sorry, but in this business, we eat people whole and chew on their bones.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Scareye.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You too are Sarkaz. You too are a part of Kazdel.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: While Theresa cannot see what expression lies behind Scareye's mask, his emotions are clear as day before her pitch-black crown.
No commoner in Kazdel would ever dare defy the Royal Court.
But in his emotions, all Theresa sees is fervor and bloodthirst.
You won't refuse.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Why would I? Do you think I'm scared they'll take revenge on me? The Royal Court's no mystery to me, Your Highness knows that plenty well.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: And let me say... You've promised me, no doubt... the best 'reward' I could ask for.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: We thrive on chaos, and I can 'see' the level of chaos you will bring upon Kazdel.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: The fact that you've kept the name 'Scar' tells me that your ideas haven't changed.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Like you said, the nations of Terra have grown tremendously in power over the last century. We could throw more revenants into the Soul Furnace and stoke its flames, but it'll not close that gap.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: So why force the people, who aren't really of the same race, to band together, call themselves the Sarkaz, and build a giant target called 'Kazdel'?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: The war between the four superpowers has proven that other Terra nations can accept our existence as mercenaries, and that's where Scar Market comes in.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: And Your Highness surely knows that we've become a community, a town, because many of us could never fit into the elitist, bloodline-obsessed Royal Court.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: In all these years, I may have helped just as many Sarkaz find a new way of life as the Six Heroes, if not even more.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: And I'm not the least bit ashamed to say it, Your Highness, King of Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Theresa doesn't reply. All she offers is a faint smile at the Cyclops.
Ah. It suddenly occurs to Scareye that this King of Sarkaz belongs to no Royal Court and represents no bloodline.
Her sole aim is to persuade the Sarkaz who are unwilling to believe that Kazdel can be built, some of whom have even committed crimes for this cause, to believe once more.
But is she enough to break free from this cycle of tragic failures, from the ending he foresaw?
Come to think of it, there's one thing I don't get, Your Highness. I might have agreed to help you...
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: But why didn't you and General Theresis simply burn this place to the ground before the day's end? I would have little chance of winning if you decided to do so.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Just like you did sixty years ago.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: A minute ago, you described 'Kazdel' as nothing but a target and that you want another way for the Sarkaz to live, one that would have them depend on other nations.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: So tell me, in your prophetic visions, have you seen Kazdel's destruction?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Have you seen my death, Theresis's death, and the destruction of all that you stand against?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: And what about yourself? How do you behold your death? A slow and agonizing death by Oripathy? Slain in battle on foreign soil? Or drowned in a sea of plots and conspiracies?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Have you ever left this place, and seen Kazdel as it is now?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Have you ever truly seen 'the future'?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Is this your way of asking for a prophecy? I don't give handouts, but for your Highness, I'll consider a discount.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Such nerve. No wonder you were able to claw your way out of this bleakness and rebuild this mercenary's paradise.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But I'll pass on the prophecy.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Prophecies and fate have no value.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It's getting late. I look forward to your return to Kazdel.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: He watches her go and heaves a long sigh only when even her footsteps fall from earshot.
Son of a bitch.
Foresight? Prophecies? His own death?
He bought his coffin this very morning.
Tally up the losses.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Boss, the slaves...
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: Set them free. They're bound to get tangled up in the Scar Market after the war begins anyway. At most, we lose out on pocket change.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Did anyone take on General Theresis and survive?
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Yes. I've noted them all down.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: Take them to supplies for a little reward. They've got real balls.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: When you're done, take them to the bar entrance and kill 'em all in front of everyone. Send their heads to General Theresis as an apology.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: ...Got it.
attributes.name: Slave Trader

attributes.content: Send their rewards to whatever family and friends they have as bereavement.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Tell every merc looking to make a living in the Scar Market, I don't want to see 'anyone' trying funny shit on my turf.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: He heads alone to the bar, the tags on his cloak jangling in his steps.
He stands prominently in the crowd, watching as the blades take the light from the mercenaries' eyes.
Still, no one fights back.
Utter disappointment.
Drinks are on the house tonight, both to celebrate the two Highnesses sparing your lives...
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: And to celebrate the huge gig you've all just landed. Your objective... is in Kazdel.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Get your shit ready. Soon, you're all gonna be in the city.
attributes.name: Scareye

attributes.content: Secret Entrance of Scar Market, Kazdel
You've been quiet for some while now, Theresa.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Are you hesitating?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: No, I have confidence in you. A reshuffle of the War Council is inevitable, it's just...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I've been thinking about the city's future. War won't stop itself at Gaul. Our pace has fallen too far behind.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Corsica I commands an indomitable fleet of dreadnoughts and guard battalions. The mad king of Leithanien has more than his Arts in his arsenal to effect Gaul's failure.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The industrial might of both Ursus and Victoria in the throes of a large-scale war has far surpassed our imaginations...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Many assume to know war like the back of their hands simply by living long enough through it.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: If our concept of war still lingers on the great battle from a century ago, then we have drastically underestimated how quickly wars can nourish empires and fuel dictatorships.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: This is exactly why we need a Military Commission.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: It's more than that, Theresis.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...I know.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: When the day comes, when the Sarkaz wish to live on, if a brittle, creaking city is all they have to call their own—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It will be far from enough.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Do you remember the idea I proposed, back when Kal'tsit was designing the city's blueprints with us?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Babel.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: To transcend the borders of race and nation. To echo far and wide in our ideals, in our epics.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Founded by a Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: We will prepare Kazdel for the coming crisis, strive to eradicate the poverty and disease that have plagued them for millennia, and send a message to all of Terra.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: There will come a future when we all stand as one. The Sarkaz, too, are part of Terra's destiny.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: This is not the first Theresis has heard of her idea.
Apart from the Dame who left after helping build the nomadic city of Kazdel many years ago, he alone knows the true belief of the current King of Sarkaz.
Kazdel won't accept this 'Babel', you and I both know that well.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: It's but a dream of attempting to subvert reality.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Yes... for now, at least, we can't be talking of such grand ideals while even our own affairs are slipping away from us.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It's my hope this 'Babel' can become a part of Kazdel, Theresis.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Are you prepared, then?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: As I said before, it's not just the other nations that will oppose you. Kazdel and the Sarkaz clinging to their hatred will also stand against you.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: It is cruel to force them to forgive and forget. The persecution of the Sarkaz is not history. The ancient hatred is what drives many to survive until this day.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I am the King of Sarkaz. The responsibility is all mine to bear. I must show them a way out of this.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...I see.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Then go. Do what you will.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Theresa, I still do not approve of your vision, but I do support your decision, and the future Military Commission will, too.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: If your gaze is set too far to see what lies before you, then I shall sweep away all that obstructs you at the moment, just as always.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Come, let's go home. Kazdel still needs us for what's about to happen.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Oh, yes. Scareye mentioned the prophecy again as I was leaving...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The signs of a pessimistic fate.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: And your reaction?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I don't care.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Agreed.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Kazdel—a strange yet familiar name.
Many from this great land see it as the pit from which devils crawl—a terrible place to be avoided at all costs.
While to the Sarkaz, the name only evokes equally conflicted emotions.
Despite generations of Sarkaz passing on that Kazdel is the Sarkaz's homeland, an outsider might wonder if they mean the city or the entirety of those lands?
Perhaps only they themselves know.
It never struck me on the way out just how high this wall is... Oh well, at least I can go home alive now. That means I'm pretty lucky.
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: That man in the Scar Market... that was General Theresis. The first of this city's founders, the hero of that legendary campaign.
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: *sigh* If I had the courage to ask him to take me in, maybe I could've just...
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: *sigh*... I'm dreaming again.
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: He sits atop the high wall, experiencing for the first time a new lease on life.
Few of Kazdel's civilian Sarkaz, save for those children who haven't yet cottoned onto the fear of death, ever climb onto the city wall.
If the tremendous pipes and tubes piled high can even be called a wall.
The intricately tangled 'forest' of Originium spikes can take the lives of anyone who loses their footing, but it also serves as a haven for pilferers and mercenaries to stash their goods.
Smugglers and vagrants cross through the dark underground, peeking out from the tunnels and drains at mines and factories, scuttling from one corner of the city to another.
The life the slave once knew.
The General gave me a fresh start. So what should I do from now on...?
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: He gazes at the furnace, burning and smoldering far away, teeming with indiscernible workers as they carry Originium, steel, dirt and stones into its hearth.
To Kazdel the nomad, its flames bring motion, while the molten metal that flows out adds new appendage to the city.
For a whole century, it's belched its incessant black smoke. None know whether it's ash or Originium dust. Some say it's the bitter anger and anguish as the revenants exhale their last breaths.
Witchcraft altars hang high in the sky, intermittently flashing their blinding rays. The slave has heard many different versions of their urban legend.
The most frightening version claims that the Royal Court's casters work day and night on the altars, watching everything and listening to every conversation in the city.
Maybe I can try my luck at the factories, too.
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: It doesn't matter what else... I've made it back alive.
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: It's been months since I left. I don't know how many of my friends are still alive...
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: The nomadic city of Kazdel, Kazdel
*Sarkaz swearing* What happened here?
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: Why are all the doors open and the furniture all smashed...
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: Pull-Top! You're back!
attributes.name: Wary Civilian

attributes.content: It's you! What are you doing here? Where'd you get that ornament?
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: Something big is happening. Royal Court nobles are being dragged out of their houses and killed by mercenaries appearing from nowhere, while the city guards do nothing!
attributes.name: Wary Civilian

attributes.content: A lot of us have been sneaking into the empty houses, and boy, have we dredged up some good stuff!
attributes.name: Wary Civilian

attributes.content: How are you still alive, though? Word got out you wanted to leave the city and find your own way, and after so long, we all assumed you died out there.
attributes.name: Wary Civilian

attributes.content: Heh. You won't believe my luck! First, I was left to die without food or water, then I was taken to the Scar Market... but guess what?
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: General Theresis saved my life, the General himself! Then, on the way home, I ran into this guy with a halo over his head, calling himself a Messenger, and he brought me all the way back to the city wall.
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: So, I've decided to change my name to Goodluck starting today. You guys can forget that lousy old name of mine.
attributes.name: Timid Slave

attributes.content: Pft, a guy with a halo? A Sankta? And then the General? You sure learned how to lie, Goodluck.
attributes.name: Wary Civilian

attributes.content: Believe me or don't, but either way, today is a fresh new start for me! I'm gonna go be a miner—
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: I looted a Nachzehrer's house earlier and found some hot air balloons. Wanna launch me on one and put that luck of yours to good use?
attributes.name: Wary Civilian

attributes.content: I'm in!
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Well, that was fast.
attributes.name: Wary Civilian

attributes.content: Man, it feels good to be home.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Goodluck glances around at the people swarming the street. This is the life he knows.
If he wants to survive, the city will always offer him a way.
Thank you, fate, and thank you, General.
attributes.name: Goodluck
